name: paymentInitiationPaymentList
description: The `/payment_initiation/payment/list` endpoint can be used to retrieve all created payments. By default, the 10 most recent payments are returned. You can request more payments and paginate through the results using the optional `count` and `cursor` parameters.

PaymentInitiationPaymentListRequest.description: PaymentInitiationPaymentListRequest defines the request schema for `/payment_initiation/payment/list`

consent_id.description: The consent ID. If specified, only payments, executed using this consent, will be returned.

count.description: The maximum number of payments to return. If `count` is not specified, a maximum of 10 payments will be returned, beginning with the most recent payment before the cursor (if specified).

cursor.description: A string in RFC 3339 format (i.e. "2019-12-06T22:35:49Z"). Only payments created before the cursor will be returned.

APIClientID.description: Your Plaid API `client_id`. The `client_id` is required and may be provided either in the `PLAID-CLIENT-ID` header or as part of a request body.
APIClientID.title: ClientID

APISecret.description: Your Plaid API `secret`. The `secret` is required and may be provided either in the `PLAID-SECRET` header or as part of a request body.
APISecret.title: APISecret

$block: PaymentInitiationPaymentListResponse defines the response schema for `/payment_initiation/payment/list`

$ul: **next_cursor**: The value that, when used as the optional `cursor` parameter to `/payment_initiation/payment/list`, will return the next unreturned payment as its first payment.
**payments**: An array of payments that have been created, associated with the given `client_id`.
**request_id**: A unique identifier for the request, which can be used for troubleshooting. This identifier, like all Plaid identifiers, is case sensitive.
